medical_history.chief_complaint: Presence of multiple, giant and small congenital melanocytic nevi involving approximately 70% of the body surface area.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The infant was delivered at 40 weeks' gestation with congenital melanocytic nevi present at birth. The baby's symptoms involved various forms of pigmented nevi, with a notable unchanged follow-up through 17 months of age. Generalized seizures began two days after birth and continued sporadically despite treatment.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Maternal history of genital herpes at 36 weeks of gestation; no significant medical history reported for the infant.
medical_history.family_history: Family history significant for a conjunctival melanoma in the maternal grandfather; no atypical nevus syndrome reported in the parents or sibling.
